node.title: Over 600 cases in Kiribati, its health minister says just 'tip of the iceberg'
node.description: Kiribati has recorded its highest daily increase in new Covid-19 infections on Tuesday, bringing the total number of positive cases to 629.

node.title: Lunar New Year: Covid thwarts travel plans for millions
node.description: An estimated 1.18 billion trips will be made across China this year, a far cry from pre-pandemic numbers.

node.title: Covid reinfections about 10% of England's cases this year, data suggests
node.description: With increased numbers of people catching the disease again since the Omicron variant began to predominate, Britain on Monday started incorporating possible reinfections into its daily data.

node.title: Dangerous winter storm forecast to sweep through several states
node.description: More than 20 different states are under winter storm warnings​, watches​ or both.

node.title: Pfizer Asks F.D.A. to Clear 2 Vaccine Doses for Young Children as a Start
node.description: The Food and Drug Administration asked to review Pfizer’s data on two doses now, while the company continues to assess whether three doses would be more effective.

node.title: Trump’s Words, and Deeds, Reveal Depths of His Drive to Retain Power
node.description: Donald Trump said he wanted Mike Pence to overturn the election, dangled pardons for Jan. 6 rioters and called for protests against prosecutors. Now, it turns out, he had discussed having national security agencies seize voting machines.

node.title: Raskin says Trump "said the criminal part out loud"
node.description: Raskin said on "Red & Blue" that he expected Ivanka Trump to speak to the committee investigating the January 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol.

node.title: Putin accuses U.S. and NATO allies of ignoring Russia's security needs
node.description: The comments were his first on the standoff in more than a month.

node.title: Trump groups head into 2022 with $122 million on hand
node.description: Their campaign finance reports include payments to legal firms representing aides who have been subpoenaed by the House select committee investigating January 6.

node.title: Engineers rule out West Coast flood prevention tactic
node.description: The West Coast Regional Council says engineering advice has ruled out the use of a cut in the Orowaiti River, to alleviate flooding during the current adverse weather.

node.title: Invercargill council holds mayoral support group in public
node.description: The Invercargill City Council held its first project governance group meeting in public instead of behind closed doors on Wednesday.

node.title: Man who died after ute and trailer plunge into Lake Dunstan named
node.description: Cromwell man Mark Gary Miller, 56, has been named by police as the person who died after a ute and trailer crashed off a bridge into Lake Dunstan on Monday evening.

node.title: Who could be behind the disappearing roses at Blenheim’s Pollard Park?
node.description: The roses at Blenheim's most picturesque park keep getting pinched.

node.title: Extreme marine heat is the "new normal" for oceans, study finds
node.description: 150 years of data, collected since 1870, shows that heat extremes are now widespread in our oceans — and delicate ecosystems may be at risk of collapse.

node.title: MMA fighter Fau Vake attack: Man pleads guilty to manslaughter
node.description: A man has pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of Fau Vake, a rising MMA fighter who was punched in a late night attack in Auckland last year.

node.title: Property values climb despite tougher lending rules, higher mortgage rates
node.description: The property market is continuing to show some momentum, with Auckland showing the biggest jump in average value in January.

node.title: Teenager helps sick kids find an escape through books
node.description: The teenager said the book drive was a form of therapy as her dad battled cancer.

node.title: Unemployment hits record low as wage inflation peaks
node.description: Unemployment has fallen to a record low, while wage inflation has risen to its highest level in a decade.

node.title: Huge house fire sends smoke across Wellington suburb
node.description: Fire crews from across Wellington battled a huge house fire that threatened neighbouring homes. One person has been taken to hospital

node.title: House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer says he tested positive for COVID-19
node.description: The 82-year-old representative said he is vaccinated and boosted.

node.title: Oath Keepers founder set to be deposed by the House January 6 Committee on Wednesday
node.description: Attorneys for Stewart Rhodes say they expect their client to invoke 5th Amendment right when interviewed by investigators.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: Today's sports news - Greenwood arrested, Kefu to host charity game and Boult in the top bracket for IPL auction.

node.title: Former Dolphins coach sues NFL and 3 teams, alleging racist hiring practices
node.description: "In certain critical ways, the NFL is racially segregated and is managed much like a plantation," the lawsuit said.

node.title: Questions Remain After Highway Crash Involving Monkeys
node.description: A Pennsylvania woman who had contact with them says she has signs of illness, but no one else has reported symptoms. And the airline that shipped them here is getting out of the business.

node.title: Brady set the GOAT bar.
node.description: With seven Super Bowl titles, his first two decades ago at age 24, Brady redefined success for N.F.L. quarterbacks.

node.title: 2 campus police officers shot at Bridgewater College in Virginia
node.description: A suspect has been taken into custody.

node.title: Dairy prices on the rise amid supply contraints
node.description: Global dairy prices have hit their highest level in eight years raising the prospect of further rises in dairy farmer payouts.

node.title: Growing calls for more support for menopause in the workplace
node.description: Experts say women should not be expected to soldier on in silence and should speak up when symptoms like insomnia and anxiety are affecting their work and their lives.

node.title: Shortage of right-hand drive EVs slowing carbon emissions progress - MIA
node.description: The Motor Industry Association will ask the government to ease back on its targets for new vehicle carbon emissions.

node.title: 'Danger time': E coli detected in Taranaki waterways after rainfall
node.description: A new fresh water testing methodology confirms that the region's waterways are contaminated with bacteria after rain, ecologists say.
